title: Ben Stokes and wife Clare shoot down 'nonsense' reports of bust-up at cricket bash

Ben Stokes' wife Clare has responded to reports of an alleged bust-up between the couple at a cricket bash.

Images emerged online appearing to show England cricket star Stokes with his hand round his wife's neck following the Professional Cricketers’ Association Awards last week.

The alleged incident happened at the Roundhouse in Camden, where Stokes won the Players' Player of the Year award.

But Clare has taken to social media to rubbish any suggestions there was violence involved.

She posted a picture of the couple from the night alongside an image of her lightheartedly grabbing Stokes' face in the car.

(Image: clarey_11/Twitter)

Clare posted: "Unbelievable what nonsense these people will make up!"

"Me and Ben messing about squishing up each other’s faces cos that’s how we show affection and some pap tries to twist it in to a crazy story!

"And all before we then have a romantic McDonalds 20 mins later!"

(Image: clarey_11/Twitter)

(Image: Instagram)

Stokes and wife Clare tied the knot in Somerset in October 2017.

They have two children together, six-year-old son Layton and daughter Libby, who is now four.

Stokes capped an incredible year for England by winning the prestigious award from the PCA.

(Image: Instagram)

The Durham star played a starring role in England's World Cup success in July before repeating the trick to save a draw with Australia in the Ashes.

Speaking after that performance, he said: "Clare has been brilliant and so supportive throughout the years.

"Your family go though everything with you, good and bad, so it is great to be able to celebrate with them at times like this.

"That is the thing for our partners who have to live the ups and downs with us and cope with the various stages we’re at.”
description: Images emerged online appearing to show England cricketer Stokes and wife Clare in an alleged physical altercation a week ago
